intro: Ardisia undulata, commonly known as the wavy-leaf ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with a wavy margin. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fruit. Ardisia undulata prefers shaded to semi-shaded environments and is relatively easy to care for in tropical and subtropical climates.
